Editorial:
Welcome to this week's issue of Azure Weekly!

Not a great deal of announcements to share:

  • New year, newly available IoT Hub Device Provisioning Service features (now GA)
  • Gain insight into your Azure Cosmos DB data with QlikView and Qlik Sense
  • Additional compute levels added to vCore-based Azure SQL databases and elastic pools
  • Cognitive Services Speech SDK 1.2 – December update – Python, Node.js/NPM and other improvements
  • Streamlined development experience with Azure Blockchain Workbench 1.6.0
  • Azure IoT Hub Toolkit 2.1.0: Great performance optimization, more code generation templates and UX improvement
  • PHP Minor Version Update for January 2019
  • Azure Site Recovery - Update Rollup 32
  • Final reminder: OMS portal moving to the Azure portal
  • Announcing the general availability of Azure Data Box Disk
  • Support for MySQL to Azure Database for MySQL online migrations
  • Support for PostgreSQL to Azure Database for PostgreSQL online migrations
  • Support for SQL to Azure SQL Database online migrations
  • New Azure Migrate and Azure Site Recovery enhancements for cloud migration
  • Multi-modal topic inferencing from videos

Here's some other content to take a look at this week: Suneet Nangia and Mark Fussell walk through Running Minecraft on Service Fabric Mesh, Kees Schollaart provides a new Azure Cost Insights ADO extension, and Christoph Siegert answers some questions on data residency and compliance in Microsoft Azure.

Groups.Description: Azure Batch AI, Azure Bot Service, Microsoft Genomics, Machine Learning services, Machine Learning Studio, Cognitive Services, Bing APIs, Computer Vision API, Content moderator, Custom Services, Emotion API, Face API, Language Understanding (LUIS), Linguistic Analysis API, QnA Maker API, Speaker Recognition API, Text Analytics API, Translator Speech API, Translator Text API, Web Language Model API
